activities: D&P uses personal information regarding: 1. Current, former, and prospective employees (“personnel”) in order to provide services and benefits to personnel and the promotion and delivery of services to clients and prospective clients; 2. Third parties (such as service providers and contractors) and their personnel in connection with the management and administration of the business relationships with such third parties or in connection with the promotion and delivery of services to clients and prospective clients; 3. Compliance with or response to governmental, professional and legal obligations or inquiries in the jurisdictions in which we operate, including investigation, preparation and defense of legal claims of or against D&P. 4. Additionally, D&P may from time to time, collect personal information from the general public in order to answer inquiries or provide information as outlined in the Privacy Statement. 5. D&P also receives client data associated with the provision of forensic and litigation consulting, corporate finance, economic consulting, and technology services.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human resources, off- and on-line data
